Consulting has always been defined by workflows: research → design → delivery → reporting. With AI, those workflows no longer run linearly. They become dynamic cycles where AI proposes, predicts, and coordinates — and humans oversee, contextualise, and guide.

We call this the Decision Chain. At every stage — from scanning signals, framing opportunities, designing solutions, predicting feasibility, orchestrating delivery, to realising value — AI is embedded. But the human role is essential: ensuring trust, nuance, and accountability.

This model is what separates AI-enabled consulting from automation. It ensures consultants remain in control of context and value, while AI accelerates the mechanics beneath them.

The AI-Enabled Decision Chain

Our new model replaces linear workflows with AI-embedded cycles, allowing humans to focus on oversight, trust, and context.

1. Signal Capture

AI scans markets, clients, and internal delivery data for early signals and opportunities.

2. Opportunity Framing

AI and human consultants collaborate to frame business cases and shape compelling bids.

3. Solution Design

AI generates potential design options; consultants validate, contextualise, and refine.

4. Feasibility Prediction

AI models risk, adoption scenarios, and delivery feasibility before client commitment.

5. Orchestration & Delivery

AI coordinates workflows and tasks; humans ensure trust, nuance, and the client relationship.

6. Value Realisation

AI tracks benefits and lessons learned; consultants guide adjustments and strategy.
